item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience from it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Education consists mainly of what we have unlearned." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Out of all the things I have lost, I miss my mind the most." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If Christ were here there is one thing he would not be—a Christian." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Let us live so that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Twain
item.description: "Of course, no man is entirely in his right mind at any time." -- Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "It is by no means an irrational fancy that, in a future existence, we shall look upon what we think our present existence, as a dream." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
Lisa add a quote by Starhawk
item.description: "The Crone, the Reaper... She is the Dark Moon, what you don't see coming at you, what you don't get away with, the wind that whips the spark across the fire line. Chance, you could say, or, what's scarier still: the intersection of chance with choices and actions made before. The brush that is tinder dry from decades of drought, the warming of the earth's climate that sends the storms away north, the hole in the ozone layer. Not punishment, not even justice, but consequence." -- Starhawk

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "To go wrong in one's own way is better then to go right in someone else's." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jurgen Moltmann
item.description: "Totally without hope one cannot live. To live without hope is to cease to live. Hell is hopelessness. It is no accident that above the entrance to Dante's hell is the inscription: "Leave behind all hope, you who enter here." -- Jurgen Moltmann

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If voting changed anything, they'd make it illegal." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Show me a sane man and I will cure him for you." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Dreams are necessary to life." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Lisa add a quote by W.B. Yeats
Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies ahead of us are tiny matters compared to what lives within us." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau
